title: Inside the garden paradise owned by Umberto Pasti, whose Moroccan home is a Noah's Ark of vanishing native plants
text:
Umberto Pasti has been described as an aesthete and a tastemaker. He is the genius who tastemakers adore. Exclamations of delight at scenes from the life of Pasti regularly feature on Instagram, from such fashionable luminaries as Jasper Conran, or Hamish Bowles of Vogue. Yet of himself and of the much-lauded interiors and gardens he has made, Pasti will say: “I am not a decorator. I just like beautiful things.”

And what he loves best, of all the beautiful things in his life, is the garden he has created in Morocco from a barren lunar landscape, 40 miles south of Tangier, overlooking the Atlantic. Here he has created his Eden. The book he has just written about it, Eden Revisited, is a poetic...
